Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Delftibactin-A (metallo-AMPs, natural AMPs; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; nonribosomal peptide; UCLL1, XXK, XXW; BBII)

Literature Information.Literature: Warning: the sequence is a close mimic as the active peptide is modified at multiple sites. S1 is a dimethylbutyl-gamma-amino acid, D2 is beta-hydroxylated, T5 is dehydrated Thr, K6 is N-hydrxy-formylornithine, K9 is N-droxy-lactam of ornithine. A synthetic peptide something like this sequemce was found to be inactive, indicating the importance of chemical modification.  The peptide is heat and protease resistant.Activity:  It is active against MRSA (MB5393), MSSA (ATCC 29213) (MIC 8 ug/mL), VRE (MIC 12.5 ug/mL), A. baumannii MB5973 and K. pneumoniae ATCC 700603 (MIC50 16 ug/ml), and P. aeruginosa (MIC50 32064 ug/ml). Showed better activity when combined with antibiotics.  Binding to metal such as gold and gallium. It can smuggled into cell via the siderophore mechanism.Toxicity: Not hemo.lytic (data?).
Literature Information.Author: Tejman-Yarden N, Robinson A, Davidov Y, et al. 2019
Literature Information.Title: Delftibactin-A, a Non-ribosomal Peptide With Broad Antimicrobial Activity
